newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Microsoft Corp launches Windows NT 4.0.
newsitem.headline: India's Microsoft Corp launches Windows NT 4.0.

text.p: Microsoft Corporation (India) Pvt Ltd on Monday announced the launch of Windows NT 4.0, the latest version of its server operating system.

"Microsoft NT Server 4.0 is a major milestone in our development. It is substantially faster, much easier to use and incorporates significantly new intranet functionality," said Rajiv Nair, the company's managing director.
Microsoft India is a 100 percent subsidiary of Microsoft Corp of the U.S.
Windows NT server provides features to reduce the number of steps required for a system administrator to install, use and manage a server, a company statement said.
Microsoft officials said the Windows NT 4.0 server is priced at 37,000 rupees. "This is probably the biggest product launch the company has done since the launch of Windows '95," Nair said.
